docs.snippet: LONDON, Oct. 20 -- Three men out of twelve who took to a tiny raft when their ship was sunk by a raider in the Atlantic have survived with a new tale of horror. For five and a half days they drifted under a fierce sun, sharks devouring those who...
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, Oct. 20 -- Three men out of twelve who took to a tiny raft when their ship was sunk by a raider in the Atlantic have survived with a new tale of horror. For five and a half days they drifted under a fierce sun, sharks devouring those who failed to regain their slender margin of safety whenever the raft capsized, which it did hundreds of times.
docs.abstract: Lt R E G Cox repts 3 out of 12 on raft 5 days survived among sharks after ship was sunk in Atlantic, Jan

docs.snippet: The latest sinkings or American-owned ships, which yesterday spurred Senatorial moves to repeal the Neutrality Act, show that the war at sea is not bounded by any latitude or longitude and that socalled "zones" have no meaning in a shooting war.

docs.snippet: The National City Bank has sold its banking offices in the Dominican Republic, consisting of the head office and five branches there, to the Government of the Dominican Republic, it was announced here yesterday. The main office is in Ciudad Trujillo,...
docs.lead_paragraph: The National City Bank has sold its banking offices in the Dominican Republic, consisting of the head office and five branches there, to the Government of the Dominican Republic, it was announced here yesterday. The main office is in Ciudad Trujillo, and the branches are at Barahona, La Vega, Puerto Plata, San Pedro de Macoris and Santiago de Los Caballeros.

headline.main: 6 BRANCHES SOLD BY NATIONAL CITY; Government of the Dominican Republic to Operate Banks in That Country

docs.snippet: JOHN GUNTHER'S "Inside Latin America,"* published this morning, lives up to expectations and Mr. Gunther's reputation. It is a highly informative, patient and good-natured report on the twenty republics to the south, written by one of our most...
docs.lead_paragraph: JOHN GUNTHER'S "Inside Latin America,"* published this morning, lives up to expectations and Mr. Gunther's reputation. It is a highly informative, patient and good-natured report on the twenty republics to the south, written by one of our most indefatigable journalists after a five months' grand tour.
